Job description

We are looking for a Machine Learning (ML) Engineer to help us create artificial intelligence products. Machine Learning Engineer responsibilities include creating machine learning models and retraining systems. To do this job successfully, you need exceptional skills in python, pytorch, tensorflow framework and edge computing and programming. If you have knowledge of data science and software engineering, we’d like to meet you. Your ultimate goal will be to shape and build efficient self-learning applications.

Responsibilities

Study and transform data science prototypes
Design machine learning systems
Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools
Develop machine learning applications according to requirements
Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods
Run machine learning tests and experiments
Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results
Train and retrain systems when necessary
Extend existing ML libraries and frameworks, python, pytorch, tensorflow framework and edge computing
Good understanding of ML Pipeline
Keep abreast of developments in the field
Skills

Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role
Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture
Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms
Ability to write robust code in Python, jupiter notebook and R
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn)
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work in a team
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills
BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics or similar field; Master’s degree is a plus

Data Scientist

The data scientist will transform data and information captured within legacy systems into value-added insights and actionable business decisions using predictive analytics. Candidates must demonstrate a history of strong technical depth, a broad base of modelling and information technology skills and a willingness to promote a collaborative, team-based approach to problem solving.

Responsibilities

· Identify opportunities where predictive analytics can enhance and accelerate decision-making, create, and execute the plan using predictive analytics to answer the business question.

· Experience in working with different data types and source systems as well as interfacing databases to enable extracting relevant data to address business questions.

· Experience in statistics/machine learning techniques to be able to use the right tool for the right question.

· Ability to communicate the results of analysis in an effective manner to stakeholders to drive action.

· Apply the right analytics tool/methodology to inform and influence decisions.

· Build decision support tools, templates, dashboards for high frequency decisions that can leverage analytics.

· Develop tools/algorithms to mine patterns in existing data to create a recommendation on future questions to consider.

· Integrate predictive analytics capabilities with knowledge management.

Requirements

· 2+ years of experience as a Data scientist.

· Experience as data scientist in insurance industry is preferrable.

· Experience in working with varied data types (structured and unstructured) and databases

· Experience in programming scripting languages including Python and R with exposure to other platforms as a plus.

· Experience in using existing statistics/machine learning tools and ability to implement custom algorithms as needed.

· Experience with visualization tools such as Powe BI

· Familiarity with big data technologies, AWS preferred.

Benefits:

· 5 days working culture.

· Benefits of permanent remote work.

· Healthy and rewarding working environment.

· Creative leadership culture focused on development.

· Opportunities for working on new technologies.

Are you a seasoned machine learning/data science practitioner?

Does delivering impact while building scalable, robust AI applications excite you?

Here at Expand AI, we are automating the data labeling process to help AI companies build high-performing ML models. A high amount of training data is required to train the ML model to perform accurately. This training data is prepared by labeling unlabeled raw data.

Currently, manual labeling is what is commonly used.

Manual data labeling has the following key pain points :

1. The labels are prone to human errors especially if the annotators don't have the right domain knowledge.

2. It takes a lot of time to manually annotate data, with annotators taking weeks or months to label data depending on the volume and the use case.

3. The manual data labeling process is costly with manual data labeling companies charging per annotation.

4. Data privacy can also become an issue with manual data labeling companies not being able to ensure 100% data privacy at scale.

At Expand AI, we have automated the data labeling process to solve the key pain points that exist with manual data labeling :

1. We provide >95% accurate labels regardless of the domain the data belongs to because our ML models can be made to be domain-specific very easily.

2. Our ML models can label each data point in one second on average and as a result, we've been able to reduce the turnaround time by at least 70%.

3. Because we use ML models to annotate data we can charge per example point instead of per annotation point and as a result, we're able to reduce the unnecessary spending on data labeling.

4. We ensure 100% data privacy at scale.

AI/ML at Expand AI :

A tangible impact on customer/patron experiences is the constant cornerstones for 'models in production.' Curiosity, humility, continuous learning, excellence, a bias for action - are a few words that summarize the colleagues you will be collaborating with across engineering, product, and business teams. Some of the problem statements being solved at Expand AI with AI/ML are :

1. Generating highly accurate labeling predictions for data points in a very low turnaround time - one second per data point (image/sentence) on average.

2. Making it easy to make the models domain-specific so that the models can give accurate predictions for any use case that the data may belong to.

Qualifications :

1. Bachelors/Masters degree in Computer Science or any other STEM degree. Preferably graduated with high distinction.

2. Should have extensive experience with building ML models in a company setting for commercial purposes and should have a good understanding of different ML algorithms.

3. Must have specialization/strong expertise in sub-area like recommendation systems, NLP, computer vision, MLOps.

4. Working know-how of dealing with large-scale data sets.

5. Clear spike in either dealing with extensive data, statistics, driving impact, ML algorithms know-how, DL architectures.

6. Expertise in programming and scripting.

Job description

Onething, is rated among top UX studios in India for 2020 by Clutch.
With a diverse portfolio of designing products for new-age tech like Electric Mobility, AI, Logistics, Big Data Analytics, Consumer Internet, etc. we are pushing boundaries through Design Thinking and its application.
Millions of users Interact directly or indirectly with products that we have helped design.
What you’ll be doing

    Working with product/business stakeholders in defining user requirements and processes.
    Facilitating the product vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping and user-testing experiences for digital products.
    Identifying design problems and devising elegant solutions.
    Working with product managers, BA’s and other key stakeholders to prioritizing design effort and execution of projects.
    Taking a user-centered design approach and rapidly testing and iterating designs.
    Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.
    Designing and delivering wireframes, user stories, user journeys, mock-ups and proof of concepts (POCs) optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces.
    Developing the visual and interactive elements of the user experience and refine a polished design, taking into consideration typography, iconography, layout and brand identity.
    Proactively testing concepts to ensure users are integral to the design process.

Job requirements

What you need to know

    A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.
    Deep understanding of design approaches, including mobile-first and responsive design.
    To iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.
    To disregard irrelevant information – to identify similarities and differences in visual configurations.
    To work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications.
    An understanding of web technologies and how developers seek to leverage design output.
    To speak and write clearly and be able to present opinions to peers.
    To simplify problems into parts and identify key data needed to support decisions.

What you need to have

    2-4 years of extensive experience in UX/UI designing with a diverse portfolio.
    Understanding of the research methodology process and its application.
    Skills to create the ideal user experience.
    Experience in applying best practices to design solutions.
    Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.

You’ll fit in if you are

    Enthusiastic, motivated and brimming with ideas
    Are passionate (with sworn vengeance) about the latest developments in technology
    A team player who can communicate and collaborate seamlessly
    Always be willing to accept new or extra work to stretch abilities.
    Actively participate in team working and meetings.
    Deliver ahead of expectations and take ownership and accountability.

CloudIQ is looking for talented and motivated professionals with profound knowledge in Devops side, who can work independently on given challenging tasks. With Cloud being the very base of the Company, experience in AWS or Azure will bring enormous advantages to your profile. The profile demands close collaboration with developers in understanding the system, articulating requirements etc., which will help in delivering the suitable build and deployment solution to get quicker TimeToLive.


Profile Demands:

    Experience in setting up CI/CD pipelines using GIT / Jenkins / VSTS etc.,
    Experience in working with Cloud computing services – AWS/Azure
    Experience in networking related services – like VPC, Subnet etc., in AWS / Azure.
    Good experience in dockerizing the applications with industry best standards.
    Experience in Kubernetes on deploying dockerized applications.
    Hands-on in the scripting like Powershell / Bash and familiarity in Python.
    Should have experience in spinning DBs and corresponding clusters.
    Proficiency in English and communication is must have. 

Optional Add-ons:

    Experience in Cloudformation and Terraform.
    Application monitoring experience – like deriving metrics and create alerts etc.,
    Ensuring critical system security using best in class cloud security solutions.
    Familiarity with BigData services like – Kinesis in AWS and Databricks in Azure.
    Cost management of Cloud resources. 

Expected Key Deliverables

    CI CD pipeline for applications being developed.
    Implementing Kubernetes deployment in CI CD pipeline.
    Thrive to incorporate automation in the deliverables, to ease the customers in using the application.
    Maintenance of the existing devops and sometimes applications deliverables.
    Documentation of the deliverables and the solutions found for the key issues.
